channel.title: CVE Feed for Puppet -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Puppet -- all products

item.title: CVE-2016-5713|2024-08-06T01:07:59.971Z -- puppet -- puppet%20agent
item.description: Versions of Puppet Agent prior to 1.6.0 included a version of the Puppet Execution Protocol (PXP) agent that passed environment variables through to Puppet runs. This could allow unauthorized code to be loaded. This bug was first introduced in Puppet Agent 1.3.0.

item.title: CVE-2016-5716|2024-08-06T01:07:59.986Z -- puppet -- puppet%20enterprise
item.description: The console in Puppet Enterprise 2015.x and 2016.x prior to 2016.4.0 includes unsafe string reads that potentially allows for remote code execution on the console node.

item.title: CVE-2016-9686|2024-08-06T02:59:03.352Z -- puppet -- puppet%20enterprise
item.description: The Puppet Communications Protocol (PCP) Broker incorrectly validates message header sizes. An attacker could use this to crash the PCP Broker, preventing commands from being sent to agents. This is resolved in Puppet Enterprise 2016.4.3 and 2016.5.2.
